chat.noModelBanner: No models available, please select a model first
chat.editDescription: Editing this message will generate a new response
chat.dragFiles: Drop files here to add to chat

setup.title: Initial Setup
setup.subtitle: Please configure model settings
setup.verifySuccessNoTool: Model verification successful, but does not support Tool Calls
setup.topPDescription: Top-P parameter controls the range of word selection. A value of 0 uses the default value; lower values select only high-probability words, resulting in conservative responses; higher values broaden the vocabulary range, leading to more varied responses.
setup.temperatureDescription: Temperature parameter controls response randomness. A value of 0 uses the default value; lower values produce more precise and stable responses; higher values generate more creative but less rigorous responses.

tools.title: Tools Management(MCP)
tools.subtitle: Tools and settings for MCP Server
tools.addServerSubtitle: Please paste MCP Server Json directly
tools.fieldTitleAlt: Fields usually satisfy most needs, but if your MCP settings require additional fields or different types, you can directly edit in the JSON TextArea on the right to meet your program requirements
tools.jsonDesc: Please enter or paste MCP Server Json in the field
tools.jsonFormatError: {{mcp}} setting format error, please check and correct the format
tools.jsonFormatError1: Only one tool is allowed in edit mode, please remove other non-tool items
tools.jsonFormatError2: Name cannot be empty, please enter a valid name
tools.jsonFormatError3: Tool {{mcp}}: Name already exists, please use a different name
tools.jsonFormatError4: Tool {{mcp}}: The field enabled must be set to true or false
tools.jsonFormatError5: Tool {{mcp}}: The field command must be a string format
tools.jsonFormatError6: Tool {{mcp}}: The field args must be an array
tools.jsonFormatError7: Tool {{mcp}}: The field env must be an object
tools.jsonFormatError8: Tool {{mcp}}: The field url must be a string format
tools.jsonFormatError9: Tool {{mcp}}: The field transport can only be {{options}}

modelConfig.title: Model Settings
modelConfig.customInstructionsDescription: These prompts will be added to the end of each request's system prompt
modelConfig.modelDescriptionHint: Model name to use (Please enter API Key first to see available models)

models.title: Model Settings
models.deleteAllDescription: After deletion, no models will be available for conversation
models.verifyingAbort: Verification interrupted, please try again later
models.apiKeyError: Invalid API Key, please check and re-enter your API Key.
models.closeAllDescription: After deactivation, no models will be available for conversation
models.noModelAlertDescription: All selected models are not supported, conversation is not possible
models.verifyIgnoreAlt: Verification reminder will no longer be shown
models.verifyNextTimeAlt: Will ask for verification next time
models.verifyDesc: The following models are not verified. Would you like to verify them?
models.progressVerifying: Model verification in progress, please wait...
models.streamingModeTooltip: Streaming Mode is when the model responds, it shows the content gradually, instead of showing it all at once. Turning off the button, in the Non-Streaming Mode, will wait for the model to generate the content completely and display it all at once, avoiding compatibility issues with tool calls in the model.
models.streamingModeDescription: Control how model responses are displayed
models.streamingModeAlert: Reminder: {{name}} model does not support tool calls in Streaming mode. If you need to use tool functionality, please turn off this button and adjust to Non-Streaming Mode.

system.title: System Settings
system.languageDescription: Language used to display the system interface. The language used in the model can be modified in the model settings page, this refers to the language displayed on the Dive interface
system.themeDescription: Switch between system default and dark mode
system.autoDownloadDescription: Automatically download the new version of DIVE when the user restarts or clicks the "Upgrade" button on the menu page, the new version will be enabled
system.autoLaunchDescription: Automatically start Dive AI when the system starts
system.minimalToTrayDescription: When the window is closed, the program will not be closed, but will be minimized to an icon
system.defaultSystemPromptDescription: Dive Default System Prompt is used as the default system prompt for chat. It tells the LLM that Dive chat supports KaTeX / Markdown / Mermaid, etc. This feature consumes certain tokens, which may make the response slower than the prompt without a system prompt. On the other hand, if it is disabled, the quality of the LLM's response may decrease
